projects.titleEn: Electrocatalytic N-functionalisation of olefins towards aziridines and amines
projects.titleNl: Elektrokatalytische N-functionalisatie van olefines ter vorming van aziridines en amines
projects.abstractEn: <p>Many N-containing key chemicals like aryl- andÃ‚\xa0alkylamines and</p><p>aziridines are synthesised through indirect methods, which have very</p><p>poor atom efficiency and produce a lot of side products. In the</p><p>context of sustainability and using renewable energy sources, new</p><p>synthetic approaches are needed, especially for chemicals with high</p><p>energy content like aziridines. The proposed research will use</p><p>electricity drivenÃ‚\xa0catalytic processes together with simple N-sources</p><p>like ammonia to produce N-containing key chemicals.</p><p>As a start, the iodide-mediated aziridination with NH3 and styrene as</p><p>the model olefin will be Ã¢â‚¬ËœelectrifiedÃ¢â‚¬â„¢. As developed by our group, this</p><p>process used a chemical oxidant, but we will now drive it by a twoelectron</p><p>anodic oxidation. We will develop theÃ‚\xa0process both for</p><p>aromatic and for aliphaticÃ‚\xa0olefins, using commercially available</p><p>electrodes to start with. Next, we will also develop Nfunctionalisations</p><p>of olefins that proceed via one-electron oxidations.</p><p>This will requireÃ‚\xa0that we harness the reactivity of the N-source, and</p><p>that we design new electrode materials for controlled oxidation of the</p><p>N-source. We focus on Ni-containing electrodes, well known from</p><p>e.g. urea oxidation. Eventually upscaling and workup of the reactions</p><p>will be demonstrated for 2 molecules of industrial interest.</p>
projects.abstractNl: <p>Heel wat N-bevattende chemicaliÃƒÂ«n (aryl- en alkylamines, aziridines)</p><p>worden door indirecte methodes gemaakt, wat een slechte</p><p>atoomeconomie en veel afvalproductie meebrengt. In de context van</p><p>duurzaamheid en gebruik van hernieuwbare energie zijn nieuwe</p><p>synthesewegen nodig, vooral voor energierijke molecules zoals</p><p>aziridines. Het project combineert elektrokatalyse met eenvoudige</p><p>stikstofbronnen, zoals ammoniak, om een aantal N-bevattende</p><p>sleutelchemicaliÃƒÂ«n te maken.</p><p>We starten met de Ã¢â‚¬ËœelectrificatieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ van de jodide-gemedieerde</p><p>aziridinatie van styreen met ammoniak. Voor deze reactie gebruikten</p><p>we eerder een chemische oxidatie, maar nu laten we de reactie</p><p>opgaan door een 2-elektron anodische oxidatie. WeÃ‚\xa0ontwikkelen het</p><p>proces zowel voor aromatische als alifatische olefines, startend met</p><p>commerciÃƒÂ«le elektrodes. Vervolgens werken we opÃ‚\xa0Nfunctionalisaties</p><p>van olefines via 1-elektron oxidaties. Dit vraagt dat</p><p>we de reactiviteit van de N-bron in bedwang houden, en dat we</p><p>nieuwe elektrodes ontwerpen voor gecontroleerde oxidatie van de Nbron.</p><p>We werken vooral met Ni-bevattende elektrodes, zoals ze ook</p><p>voor ureum oxidatie gebruikt worden. Tenslotte tonenÃ‚\xa0we de</p><p>opschaling en opwerking van de reacties voor 2 industrieel</p><p>interessante molecules.</p><p>Ã‚\xa0</p>

keywordsEn: Unemployment; resilience; long-term unemployed youth; wellbeing; job search
projects.abstractNl: <p>Werkloosheid is een belangrijk maatschappelijkÃ‚\xa0probleem, met een negatieve impact op welvaart, welzijn en gezondheid. Deze studie onderzoekt de rolÃ‚\xa0van veerkracht en de samenhangen ervan met welzijn en het vinden van werk bij jonge langdurig werklozen. Studie 1 exploreert de aanwezigheid van veerkracht en de correlaten ervan in een kwalitatieveÃ‚\xa0studie. Studie 2 verruimt de vorige studie door veerkracht te onderzoeken in een cross-sectionele kwantitatieve studie, waarbij tevens de samenhang wordtÃ‚\xa0onderzocht met de beoordeling (Ã¢â‚¬ËœappraisalÃ¢â‚¬â„¢) van werkloosheid, coping strategieÃƒÂ«n, jobzoekgedrag enÃ‚\xa0welzijn. Studie 3 onderzoekt de antecedenten en gevolgen van veerkracht na 6 maanden. De resultatenÃ‚\xa0van deze studieÃ‚\xa0zullen toelaten om wetenschappelijke theorieÃƒÂ«n over werkloosheid en veerkracht te verfijnen, en om interventies uit te werken om veerkracht te verhogen bij jonge langdurig werklozen, rekening houdend met de context en cultuur van hetÃ‚\xa0land.</p>', 'englishAbstract': '<p>Unemployment is a major social problem that adversely impacts individualÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s welfare, healthÃ‚\xa0and well-being. This study examines the role of resilienceÃ‚\xa0and its associations with well-beingÃ‚\xa0and behaviorsÃ‚\xa0linked to re-employment, and focuses on a specific group at-risk: long-term unemployed youth. StudyÃ‚\xa01 explores the existenceÃ‚\xa0and correlates of resilience in a qualitative study. Study 2 extends the findings of study 1 by exploring resilience in a cross-sectional quantitativeÃ‚\xa0sample, and analyses its association with appraisals of unemployment, coping strategies, job seeking and well-being. StudyÃ‚\xa03 examines the antecedents and (behavioral and well-being) consequencesÃ‚\xa0of resilience over time. TheÃ‚\xa0results of thisÃ‚\xa0project can be used to refine scientific theoriesÃ‚\xa0on resilience and unemployment, and to develop interventions to increase resilienceÃ‚\xa0among longÃ‚\xa0term unemployed youth, that are aligned to the contextual and cultural framework of their country.</p>

publications.abstractEn: The application and production of alternative plasticizers (APs) has been increasing in the last decade in replacement of conventional phthalates due to their toxicity. This calls for the development of non-invasive monitoring approaches to assess human exposure to APs. A method for the simultaneous measurement of exposure biomarkers of di(2-propylheptyl) phthalate (DPHP), di(isononyl)cyclohexane-1,2-dicarboxylate (DINCH), di(2-ethylhexyl) terephthalate (DEHTP) and di-2-ethylhexyl adipate (DEHA) in hair samples was developed and validated in this study. Prior to the analysis, the hair samples were washed in acetone and ultrapure water and pulverized to powder. Further, a solid-liquid and solid-phase extraction, followed by quantification using liquid chromatography - tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) was performed. The method was validated in terms of recovery, matrix effects, carry-over, linearity, limits of quantification, within- and between-run precision and trueness. Satisfying results were obtained for all targeted compounds, except for mono(2-ethylhexyl) adipate (MEHA), which was monitored only qualitatively. The optimized method was implemented in a pilot biomonitoring study with hair samples from 9 healthy volunteers. Detection frequencies of seven metabolites ranged from 11% to 100%. Mono(2-ethylhexyl) terephthalate (MEHTP) and mono(2-ethyl-5-oxohexyl) adipate (oxo-MEHA) were found in all hair samples. More hydrophobic monoester metabolites were found to be incorporated in hair to a greater extent compared to their oxidized counterparts. Obtained results show that the developed method can detect AP metabolites in hair, supporting the use of this alternative matrix in human biomonitoring.', 'abstractNl': null, 'titleEn': 'Hair as an alternative matrix to monitor human exposure to plasticizers - Development of a liquid chromatography - tandem mass spectrometry method
